title: Further Extending the TikTok Enforcement Delay

enrichment.summary: This executive order delays enforcement of the law restricting TikTok and similar foreign adversary controlled applications until September 17, 2025, preventing penalties and enforcement actions during this period. It directs the Department of Justice to refrain from enforcement actions related to prior conduct as well and to issue guidance and communications ensuring no liability for violators within the delay period.
potential_concerns: Extending the enforcement delay may allow continued use of apps that pose potential national security risks.
Delaying enforcement could undermine the effectiveness and credibility of the Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act.
The order may create uncertainty for companies and consumers regarding compliance obligations and liability.
State governments or private parties might attempt to enforce the law, leading to possible legal conflicts with federal authority.
The indefinite backward waiver of penalties for prior conduct may incentivize future noncompliance with similar statutes.
